name: Jason Kuhafkan
body:
***
## Summary 
I am an entry-level full-stack web developer who is about to graduate from PDX Code Guild, a software development "bootcamp" emphasizing Python and Django. Before attending this program, I had been teaching myself web development for over a year. I also have professional experience in technical support, QA, and technical writing.
##### [(email me)](mailto:jkuhafkan@gmail.com)

***
## Skills
**Python, Django,** MVC, **HTML/CSS, JavaScript,** jQuery, Git, AJAX, **MySQL,** PostgreSQL, AWS, **Bootstrap,** REST, AngularJS, Bugzilla, Test Driven Development, Pair Programming, Ruby, LAMP/MAMP, **APIs,** Web Crawling, **JSON,** XML, WordPress, PHP

***
## Education

### PDX Code Guild
Junior Developer Bootcamp  
October 2014

### San Francisco State University
BA, Broadcast and Electronic Communication Arts  
August 2009

***

## Work Experience 

### Freelance Web Developer  
August 2014 - Present  
Built website for [World Agricultural Heritage Foundation](http://worldagriculturalheritage.org) using custom WordPress theme built on Bootstrap. 

### Administrative Assistant  
Hirsch & Associates, LLC  
June 2013 – Jan 2014  
Coordinated client billing for philanthropic consulting firm.

### Coordinator of Dissemination and Training  
Larkin Street Youth Services  
Feb 2011 – Sept 2011
Served as primary liaison between research and direct service programs, contributing to data reporting, conference participation, and technical assistance to outside organizations.

### Technical Support Engineer  
3VR  
Dec 2009 – Feb 2011  
Provided Tier 2 technical support for video analytics platform, primarily to resellers. Contributed heavily to other departments including support scripts, QA, and RMA refurbishment.
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
